intro: Enchylaena tomentosa var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy broad-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand dry conditions. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
